msg_perm_request: To receive notifications, please allow them in Settings.
search_hint: Search by address or bin name
guide_disclaimer: * Please check the official Sapporo City guide for details.
note_burnable:
- Drain excess water from food waste
- Soak cooking oil in paper/cloth
- Dirty paper and diapers go here
- Use designated bags
note_spray:
- Use up contents without punching holes
- Put in transparent/semi-transparent bag
- Put out separately on Burnable Garbage day
note_non_burnable:
- Glass, ceramics, small appliances
- Wrap sharp objects in paper and write 'DANGER'
- Use designated bags
note_lighter:
- Use up contents
- Soak in water, then put in transparent bag
- Put out separately on Non-Burnable day
note_recyclable:
- Rinse inside
- Remove caps/labels from PET bottles (put in Plastic)
- Put in transparent/semi-transparent bag
note_battery:
- Alkaline/Manganese batteries only
- Put in transparent bag
- Put out separately on Bottle/Can day
note_plastic:
- Items with Plastic mark
- Rinse off dirt (if dirty, burnable)
- Do not double bag
note_paper:
- Paper boxes, envelopes, toilet paper rolls, etc.
- Put in paper bag or tie with string
note_green:
- Bundle branches (approx. 50cm)
- Put grass/leaves in transparent bag
- Do not mix with food waste
important_notices: Put out garbage by 8:30 AM on collection day
Garbage not in designated bags will not be collected
Schedule changes during New Year holidays
Collection may be canceled during severe weather
map_help_desc_1: This map shows "Resource Recovery Bases" and "Cooperating Stores".
map_help_desc_2: Regular neighborhood trash stations (yellow nets) are NOT shown here.
map_help_desc_3: Use this map to find places to drop off recyclables like batteries or small electronics while shopping.
map_help_list_items:
・Paper (Newspaper, Cardboard)
・Empty Bottles / Cans
・Used Batteries
・Fluorescent Lights
・Used Cooking Oil
・Small Electronics
map_help_source: Data Source: Sapporo City Open Data
